revised_title: The Role of Isocitrate Lyase in Algae Metabolism
tldr: The study investigates the role of isocitrate lyase in the metabolism of algae, specifically the Brannon no. 1 strain of Chlorella vulgaris. The researchers found that the algae contained an active isocitrate lyase under all growth conditions, but the enzyme only participates in the glyoxylate cycle when incorporated into a particulate structure. This discovery challenges the assumption that the presence of isocitrate lyase in an organism is sufficient for the glyoxylate cycle to operate.
